name: J Riley Harrington
description: When the company needs starting, someone needs to do it. This guy really just wanted to be a programmer but no company would make the exact game he wanted to play so he had to start his own. What other options did he have?

name: Stuart Harrington
description: Brother to Riley. Also a great artist with a love for video games and a respect for details that make games great. Stu is in charge of artistic direction of all games at Sleepy Fish as well as much of the game design and asset creation itself.

name: Hannah Rucker
description: The glue that keeps this company together. I would say she is the unsung hero but we actually find ourselves singing about her often. She takes care of all the business of building a company and keeping wandering minds in line and working effeciently. She if the difference between a functional company and abunch of dweeps on their computers.

name: Jeremy Doss
description: Jeremy has a passion for programming and it shows in his work. Originally a .NET programmer, he dove into game programming on a quest to conquer new and uncharted parts of his craft. He works on our core platform games and manages engineering day to day challanges.

name: Lauren Grills
description: She writes clean code. She builds clean UIs. She moves projects forward like the little tank engine that could. That is why we like her. Getting her start in database administration she took on the challange of learning game programming to develop new skills and contibute to a creative and collabrative endevour.

name: Caleb Rogers
description: Caleb has a spirit of someone who will never stop learning knew skills. He came onto our team as a web engineer to help our website and work on browser game jams. He is quickly taking on a role of game engineer as he dives into our core platform games.

name: Could Be You
description: We are looking for help with bringing our art to life. 3D modelling, 2D / 3D rigging and animating. If you have a passion for creating characters, making interactive environments, and ultimately building immersive game experiences we could really use the help!

name: Could Be You
description: We have got some great ideas in the works here at Sleepy Fish but we are in constant need of help refining and making those ideas concrete and fleshed out as well as add new great ideas to the pool. This role involves designing game mechanics, story-boarding, writing, and working closely artists and engineers to actualize our shared vision. If you want to get involved in the creative side of designing games we are accepting all the help we can get.
